heroIntro: Discover your Mediterranean escape in this exceptional 3-bedroom bungalow located in the heart of Ciudad Quesada, Costa Blanca. Whether you're imagining lazy afternoons by your own space, exploring nearby Blue Flag beaches, or enjoying world-class golf courses, this Ciudad Quesada home delivers an authentic Mediterranean experience at 40% less than comparable Spanish island properties. The established international community here means you'll find English-speaking support throughout your ownership journey, making this holiday home investment both accessible and practical. Located in one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after residential communities, you're just minutes from stunning coastlines, excellent amenities, and a vibrant expat network that makes settling in effortless.
areaSection: Ciudad Quesada stands as one of Costa Blanca's most desirable residential communities, strategically positioned between the bustling coastal towns and the quieter, more peaceful inland landscape. This purpose-built development has earned its reputation through careful urban planning that balances modern convenience with Mediterranean tranquility. The climate here is exceptional year-round, with over 300 days of sunshine annually, making it an ideal base for holiday home owners who want guaranteed good weather for their escapes. The area benefits from natural elevation that provides cooler summer temperatures and refreshing sea breezes, while winter months remain mild and pleasant. Ciudad Quesada's development has been gradual and controlled, ensuring that infrastructure and amenities have developed alongside the community. The result is a well-established town with mature facilities, reliable services, and a cosmopolitan atmosphere that welcomes international residents.
lifestyleSection: Life in Ciudad Quesada revolves around a relaxed Mediterranean rhythm that celebrates outdoor living and community spirit. Your daily routine might include morning coffee at one of the many local cafés where English is widely spoken, shopping at well-stocked supermarkets like Mercadona and Lidl, or browsing the vibrant weekly markets for fresh local produce. The established international community means you'll find familiar restaurants, social clubs, and activities tailored to expat preferences, yet you're never far from authentic Spanish culture. Healthcare access is excellent, with English-speaking doctors available at private clinics and a regional hospital within 30 minutes for any serious needs. The beaches are your playground – multiple Blue Flag beaches sit just 20 minutes away, perfect for weekend swims or sunset walks. Golf enthusiasts have several championship courses nearby, while the reliable public transport system keeps you connected, though most residents enjoy the flexibility and freedom that comes with having a car.
investmentSection: This property represents a compelling investment opportunity in a market experiencing robust growth. Ciudad Quesada's premium segment has grown 8% year-on-year, significantly outpacing inflation and traditional investment returns. At €361,000, you're purchasing at €4,247 per square meter – premium specification pricing for a property that could generate €800 per week in holiday lettings, potentially delivering 11-12% annual returns. Compare this to Spanish island properties commanding €7,000+ per square meter with similar specifications, and the value proposition becomes clear. The established infrastructure, international community, and proven rental demand mean your holiday home isn't just a personal escape – it's a tangible asset appreciating alongside the wider Costa Blanca market recovery. For investors seeking European property exposure with accessible entry points and reliable rental income, Ciudad Quesada offers an increasingly attractive alternative to saturated coastal markets.
conclusion: This 3-bedroom bungalow in Ciudad Quesada represents your opportunity to own a Mediterranean holiday home that delivers both lifestyle enjoyment and investment potential. At €361,000 with premium specifications at 40% less than Spanish island alternatives, you're acquiring real value in a market experiencing steady appreciation. Whether you envision lazy Mediterranean summers, weekend golf retreats, or a reliable rental income stream, this property positions you perfectly within Costa Blanca's most mature and welcoming international community. The combination of accessibility (38km from Alicante Airport), established infrastructure, proven rental demand, and exceptional year-round climate makes this not just a property purchase – it's an investment in your European lifestyle. faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca is an excellent property investment destination, particularly for holiday home buyers. The region experiences consistent growth (8% year-on-year in premium segments), offers proven rental demand, has an established international community, and provides Mediterranean lifestyle at accessible prices compared to other European destinations.

faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain with the same legal rights as Spanish citizens. UK and international buyers need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), though the process is straightforward. Most property transactions complete within 6-12 weeks with professional legal assistance.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Cost of living in Costa Blanca is significantly lower than UK equivalents. Groceries, dining, utilities, and entertainment are 20-30% cheaper than UK prices. Healthcare is excellent and affordable. Owning a holiday home here means enjoying Mediterranean lifestyle at a fraction of typical UK expenses.

faqs.question: À quelle distance se trouve la Costa Blanca de la France ?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is just 38km from Ciudad Quesada with direct flights to the UK taking 2-2.5 hours. This makes Costa Blanca easily accessible for frequent visitors or weekend getaways, ideal for holiday home owners maintaining UK connections.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys over 300 days of sunshine annually with average temperatures of 17-28°C. Winters are mild (rarely below 10°C) and summers are warm (30-35°C) with refreshing sea breezes. This exceptional climate makes it perfect for year-round holiday home enjoyment.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreign buyers can obtain Spanish mortgages through banks and building societies. Most lenders offer 60-80% loan-to-value financing for holiday home purchases. Interest rates are competitive and the process, while requiring documentation, is accessible with professional assistance.

faqs.question: How is the internet and connectivity in Ciudad Quesada?
faqs.answer: Internet connectivity in Ciudad Quesada is excellent with multiple fiber-optic providers offering speeds of 100-300 Mbps. Mobile networks are reliable across the area. This makes remote working straightforward for digital nomads and entrepreneurs seeking a Mediterranean base.

faqs.question: Is Ciudad Quesada good for families with children?
faqs.answer: Yes, Ciudad Quesada is family-friendly with international schools nearby, safe residential infrastructure, beaches for recreation, and a welcoming expat community. The balanced lifestyle between modern amenities and Mediterranean relaxation appeals to families seeking holiday home experiences.
